rows: Diplomatic Note of the Embassy of Switzerland in Sri Lanka on 30 December 2019
On December 30, 2019, the Embassy of Switzerland in Sri Lanka sent a Diplomatic Note to the Ministry of Foreign Relations of Sri Lanka. The Embassy has also released this Note simultaneously.
High Commissioner of Sri Lanka to Nigeria Presents Credentials
The Sri Lankan High Commissioner to Nigeria, A. Sabarullah Khan, presented his credentials to the President of Nigeria, Muhammadu Buhari, on December 24, 2019, at the Presidential Villa in Abuja.
Foreign Minister Gunawardena attends Award Ceremony of Institute of Economic Studies in Colombo

Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena attended an award ceremony organized by the Institute of Economic Studies (IES) of India in Colombo. The event focused on "Indo-Sri Lanka Economic Cooperation," with Minister Gunawardena serving as the Chief Guest.
Sri Lanka Embassy facilitates repatriation of 33 Sri Lankan migrant workers from Kuwait

The Sri Lanka Embassy in Kuwait, with the cooperation of Kuwaiti authorities, successfully repatriated 33 Sri Lankan migrant workers back to Sri Lanka on December 23, 2019. The Embassy facilitated the issuance of travel documents for their return.
Sri Lanka’s engagement with the UNDP to be focused on revitalized drive for economic development and achieving Sustainable Development Goals

Sri Lanka is focusing its engagement with the UNDP on revitalizing economic development and achieving Sustainable Development Goals. Kanni Wignaraja, Assistant Secretary General of the United Nations and Director of the Regional Bureau for Asia and the Pacific of the UNDP, is currently visiting the country to discuss these initiatives.
‘Revitalized Africa Policy’ to guide Sri Lanka’s engagement with Africa

Sri Lanka's Foreign Secretary, Ravinatha Aryasinha, announced the implementation of the new 'Revitalized Africa Policy' to boost cooperation in political, economic, and cultural areas with African nations. This policy aims to guide Sri Lanka's engagement with Africa across various spheres effectively.
Foreign Ministers of Sri Lanka and Switzerland exchange views on arrest of Sri Lankan employee of Swiss Mission

Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena received a call from Swiss Foreign Minister Ignazio Cassis to discuss the arrest of Sri Lankan employee Ms. G at the Swiss Embassy. The exchange of views aimed to address the status of the employee and the situation between Sri Lanka and Switzerland.
Foreign Secretary Aryasinha calls for the regaining of Sri Lanka’s economic prominence in Egypt

Foreign Secretary Ravinatha Aryasinha has urged for Sri Lanka to reclaim its economic prominence in Egypt to its traditional strength, aligning with their shared history and strong bilateral political relations. This call aims to enhance economic ties between the two countries and boost Sri Lanka's position in the Egyptian market.
Foreign Minister Motegi reaffirms Japan’s support to broaden cooperation with Sri Lanka

Japanese Foreign Minister Toshimitsu Motegi reaffirmed Japan’s support for broadening cooperation with Sri Lanka during a meeting with Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena in Colombo. The two ministers recalled the significant milestones in their mutually rewarding relations.
Foreign Minister calls for concrete action on SAARC intra-regional trade

Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena urged SAARC Member Countries to enhance intra-regional trade while addressing security concerns. He made the call during an event to commemorate the importance of strengthening trade relations within the region.
Sri Lanka Elected Chair of Biological Weapons Convention Meet
Sri Lanka has been elected as the Chair of the Meeting of States Parties to the Biological Weapons Convention. The endorsement came unanimously at the conclusion of the four-day session in Geneva.
Message of Hon. Minister of Foreign Relations on the 35th SAARC Charter Day on 8 December 2019
Message of Hon. Prime Minister on the 35th SAARC Charter Day on 8 December 2019
Message of H.E the President on the 35th SAARC Charter Day on 8 December 2019
Foreign Ministry comments on the Judgement in the Case of Brigadier Priyanka Fernando

The Foreign Ministry has commented on the judgement in the case of Majuran Sathananthan vs. Brigadier Andige Priyanka Indunil Fernando. The trial was completed at the Westminster Magistrates’ Court on 19 November 2019, with the Chief Magistrate delivering the verdict.
Maldivian Foreign Minister Abdulla Shahid appreciates deep rooted bilateral relations

Maldivian Foreign Minister Abdulla Shahid expressed appreciation to Sri Lanka's Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena for their longstanding partnership in socio-economic development, highlighting the deep-rooted bilateral relations between the two countries.
Media Statement : Sri Lanka’s High Commissioner protests on Conservative Party manifesto  reference to Sri Lanka

The Ministry of Foreign Relations has noted remarks by MP Udaya Gammanpila on 3 December 2019 regarding Sri Lanka's mention in the Conservative Party manifesto. Sri Lanka's High Commissioner has lodged a protest over this reference.
Pakistan Foreign Minister Qureshi calls for optimising bilateral economic linkages

Pakistan Foreign Minister Makhdoom Shah Mehmood Qureshi visited Sri Lanka for a two-day trip and met with Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena to discuss enhancing bilateral economic ties. The meeting took place at the Foreign Ministry on Monday, where they focused on optimizing economic linkages between the two countries.
Update on the alleged incident relating to Swiss Embassy staff member

The Government of Sri Lanka responded promptly to the alleged criminal incident involving a Swiss Embassy staff member in Colombo on November 25, 2019. They have taken serious action following the incident.
UNODC Director Operations Miwa Kato calls on Foreign Minister Gunawardena
UNODC Director of Operations, Miwa Kato, visited Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena at the Ministry on November 28, 2019. During the meeting, the Minister expressed appreciation for the visit.
State Minister Susil Premajayantha reiterates need to maintain close ties with neighbouring states

State Minister Susil Premajayantha emphasized the importance of maintaining strong relationships with neighboring states during his assumption of duties as the State Minister of International Cooperation on 28 November 2019. He was welcomed by Foreign Secretary Ravinatha Aryasinha and other senior officials upon his arrival.
President Gotabaya Rajapaksa undertakes State Visit to India

President Gotabaya Rajapaksa is set to undertake a State Visit to India on November 29-30, 2019, following an invitation from Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The visit will include meetings with Indian officials, including Prime Minister Modi.
Alleged incident relating to Swiss Embassy staff member

The Government of Sri Lanka has expressed concern over an alleged criminal incident involving a locally recruited staff member of the Swiss Embassy in Colombo on November 25, 2019. Authorities are investigating the matter to determine the facts surrounding the incident.
Minister Dinesh Gunawardena calls on Foreign Ministry Officials to rise to new challenges

Minister of Foreign Relations Dinesh Gunawardena assumed duties at the Foreign Ministry on Monday, November 25, 2019. He was received by Foreign Secretary Ravinatha Aryasinha and other senior officials, calling on them to rise to new challenges. Gunawardena urged the Foreign Ministry officials to be prepared for the evolving global landscape.
Sri Lanka has provided valuable case studies of successes and challenges in operationalization of IHL and Humanitarian Diplomacy – Foreign Secretary Aryasinha

Foreign Secretary Ravinatha Aryasinha highlighted that Sri Lanka has offered valuable case studies over the past four decades, showcasing successes and challenges in implementing International Humanitarian Law and Humanitarian Diplomacy to the global community.
Commonwealth Secretary General visits mangrove site on the sidelines of Commonwealth Law Ministers Conference in Colombo

Commonwealth Secretary General, Rt. Hon. Patricia Scotland, visited a mangrove site in Colombo during the Commonwealth Law Ministers Conference. She was accompanied by officials from the Ministries of Foreign Affairs and Mahaweli Development & Environment, along with representatives from INSEE.
Foreign Secretary Aryasinha calls for Indian Ocean security architecture that gives priority to the littoral states and sensitive to the interests of all maritime users

Foreign Secretary Ravinatha Aryasinha advocates for an Indian Ocean security architecture that prioritizes the littoral states and considers the interests of all maritime users. This framework aims to address regional security challenges effectively.
Sri Lanka and Poland pledge to enhance connectivity and economic cooperation

Sri Lanka and Poland have pledged to enhance connectivity and economic cooperation. This commitment was solidified through the signing of a Memorandum of Understanding on the Establishment of a Political Consultations Mechanism between the State Minister of Foreign Affairs of Sri Lanka, Vasantha Senanayake, and the Deputy Foreign Minister of Poland, Maciej Lang.
Appointment of the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Delegation of the European Union to Sri Lanka

The Delegation of the European Union, with the approval of the Government of Sri Lanka, has named Mr. Denis Chaibi as the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary to Sri Lanka. Mr. Chaibi will represent the European Union in diplomatic matters in Sri Lanka.
Appointment of the High Commissioner of Federal Republic of Nigeria to Sri Lanka
The Government of Nigeria, in agreement with Sri Lanka, has appointed Maj. Gen. Chris Eze (Rtd.) as the new High Commissioner of Nigeria to Sri Lanka.
Appointment of the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of Lebanon to Sri Lanka

The Government of Lebanon, with the approval of Sri Lanka, has named Mr. Rabie Narsh as the new Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Lebanon to Sri Lanka. Mr. Narsh will represent Lebanon in Sri Lanka in his diplomatic capacity.
Sri Lanka calls for collective action to address contemporary global challenges

At the 18th Summit of the Non-Aligned Movement in Baku, Azerbaijan on October 26, 2019, Foreign Minister Tilak Marapana reiterated Sri Lanka's dedication to the core principles of the NAM. He called for collective action to tackle contemporary global challenges, emphasizing the importance of unity among member nations.
Foreign Minister Tilak Marapana leads Sri Lanka Delegation to the 18th Summit of the Non-Aligned Movement

Foreign Minister Tilak Marapana is leading the Sri Lanka delegation to the 18th Summit of the Non-Aligned Movement in Baku, Azerbaijan. He arrived in Baku on Tuesday for the summit, which brings together Heads of State and Government from NAM member countries.
Foreign Secretary Aryasinha emphasizes Sri Lanka’s commitment towards an overarching security architecture in the Indian Ocean Region

Foreign Secretary Ravinatha Aryasinha highlights Sri Lanka's dedication to establishing a comprehensive security framework in the Indian Ocean Region. He stresses the importance of developing institutional structures to effectively address security challenges in the area.
Foreign Ministry comments on the case of Brigadier Priyanka Fernando in London

The retrial of Brigadier Priyanka Fernando in London, in the case of Majuran Sathananthan vs. Brigadier Andige Priyanka Indunil Fernando, began on October 18, 2019, at the Westminster Magistrates’ Court. The Court listened to the arguments presented by the private prosecutor during the proceedings.
Visit to Venezuela by State Minister of Foreign Affairs
During the recent official visit to Venezuela, State Minister of Foreign Affairs Vasantha Senanayake was greeted by President Nicolas Maduro during a courtesy call.
Condolence Message of the Late Ven. Kurunegoda Piyatissa Maha Thero Chief Incumbent of New York Maha Vihara

Condolences are being offered following the passing of the Late Ven. Kurunegoda Piyatissa Maha Thero, Chief Incumbent of New York Maha Vihara. The community mourns the loss of the respected spiritual leader.
Colombo meeting presses for rationalization of areas of cooperation and adoption of a BIMSTEC Charter

At the Colombo meeting, participants discussed rationalizing areas of cooperation within BIMSTEC and the adoption of a BIMSTEC Charter. The meeting also involved deliberations on a draft Memorandum of Understanding.
Sri Lanka assures support to further the Global Disarmament Agenda

Sri Lanka's Foreign Secretary Ravinatha Aryasinha has assured the UN High Representative on Disarmament, Izumi Nakamitsu, of Sri Lanka's support to further the Global Disarmament Agenda. The commitment was made during a meeting between the two officials.
Sri Lanka hosts the First Meeting of the Mangrove Ecosystems and Livelihood Action Group under the Commonwealth Blue Charter

Sri Lanka hosted the First Meeting of the Mangrove Ecosystems and Livelihood Action Group (MELAG) under the Commonwealth Blue Charter from 7 to 9 October 2019 in Negombo. The event brought together participants to discuss conservation efforts and sustainable livelihoods in mangrove ecosystems.
At UNGA Sri Lanka calls for an integrated and balanced                                     approach in the prevention of drug use and abuse

At the UNGA, Sri Lanka emphasized the need for an integrated and balanced approach to prevent drug use and abuse. The country highlighted the importance of reducing both supply and demand, as well as combating trafficking to address this issue effectively.
Notice to Members of the General Public

The Consular Affairs Division of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs is facing a slowdown in the electronic Document Attestation System (e-DAS) due to technical issues. This may cause delays in processing document attestations. We apologize for any inconvenience and are working to resolve the problem promptly.
Esala Weerakoon approved as the next Secretary-General of SAARC
Esala Weerakoon has been approved as the next Secretary-General of SAARC during the Informal Meeting of the Council of Ministers in New York. He is a former Foreign Secretary and senior diplomat.
Appointment of the Ambassador of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia to Sri Lanka

The Government of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia, in agreement with the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mrs. Tizita Mulugeta as the Ambassador of Ethiopia to Sri Lanka. Mrs. Mulugeta will represent Ethiopia in her new role in Sri Lanka.
Appointment of the Ambassador of the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela

The Government of the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela, with the agreement of the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mrs. Coromoto Godoy Calderon as the new Ambassador of Venezuela to Sri Lanka. Mrs. Calderon will represent Venezuela in Sri Lanka as its official diplomatic representative.
Appointment of the Ambassador of Ireland to Sri Lanka

The Government of Ireland, with the agreement of the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mr. Brendan Ward as the new Ambassador of Ireland to Sri Lanka, succeeding H.E. (Mr.) Brian McElduff. Mr. Ward has already presented his credentials.
Appointment of the Ambassador of the Republic of Bulgaria to Sri Lanka

The Government of the Republic of Bulgaria, with the approval of the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mrs. Eleonora Dimitrova Dimitrova as the new Ambassador of Bulgaria to Sri Lanka. Mrs. Dimitrova Dimitrova will assume the role in succession.
Appointment of the Ambassador of the Republic of Chile to Sri Lanka

The Government of the Republic of Chile, with the concurrence of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mr. Juan Rolando Angulo Monsalve as the new Ambassador of Chile to Sri Lanka, succeeding H.E. [Ambassador's name].
Appointment of the Ambassador of the Hellenic Republic to Sri Lanka

The Government of the Hellenic Republic, in agreement with the Government of Sri Lanka, has named Mr. Dionyssios Kyvetos as the new Ambassador of the Hellenic Republic to Sri Lanka, succeeding H.E. (Mr.) Pan.
Appointment of the High Commissioner of the Republic of Namibia to Sri Lanka

The Government of the Republic of Namibia, with the approval of the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mr. Gabriel Pandureni Sinimbo as the new High Commissioner of Namibia to Sri Lanka. He succeeds the previous High Commissioner in this role.
Appointment of the Ambassador of the Republic of Guinea to Sri Lanka

The Government of the Republic of Guinea, with the concurrence of the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mrs. Fatoumata Balde as the new Ambassador of the Republic of Guinea to Sri Lanka, succeeding H.E. (Mr.) Alexa.
Appointment of the Ambassador of the Republic of the Sudan to Sri Lanka

The Government of the Republic of the Sudan, with the agreement of the Government of Sri Lanka, has named Mr. Ahmed Yousif Mohamed Elsiddig as the new Ambassador of the Republic of the Sudan to Sri Lanka.
Appointment of the Ambassador of Bosnia & Herzegovina to Sri Lanka

The Government of Bosnia & Herzegovina, with the approval of the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mr. Muhamed Čengić as the new Ambassador of Bosnia & Herzegovina to Sri Lanka. He will succeed the previous ambassador in this role.
Appointment of the Ambassador of the Portuguese Republic to Sri Lanka

The Government of the Portuguese Republic, with the agreement of the Government of Sri Lanka, has named Mr. Carlos José de Pinho e Melo Pereira Marques as the new Ambassador of the Portuguese Republic to Sri Lanka.
Appointment of the Ambassador of the Republic of Benin to Sri Lanka

The Government of the Republic of Benin, in agreement with the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mr. Makarimi Abissola Adechoubou as the new Ambassador of Benin to Sri Lanka, succeeding H.E. [Ambassador's name].
Appointment of the Ambassador of the Kingdom of Belgium to Sri Lanka

The Government of Belgium, with the approval of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mr. François Delhaye as the new Ambassador to Sri Lanka, succeeding H.E. (Mr.) J. This appointment signifies a new chapter in diplomatic relations between the two countries.
Appointment of the High Commissioner of the Kingdom of Eswatini to Sri Lanka

The Government of the Kingdom of Eswatini, in agreement with the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mr. Mlondi Solomon Dlamini as the new High Commissioner of Eswatini to Sri Lanka. Mr. Dlamini will assume the role in succession.
Sri Lanka says tangible assistance needed to consolidate on Sri Lanka’s restoration of normalcy post 21/4

Sri Lanka's Foreign Secretary, Ravinatha Aryasinha, leading the delegation to the UN General Assembly, met with Mr. Vladimir Voronkov to discuss the need for tangible assistance in consolidating the country's restoration of normalcy post the 21/4 attacks. Sri Lanka emphasizes the importance of international support in this process.
Address to the 74th UN General Assembly by Mr. Ravinatha P Aryasinha, Secretary, Foreign Affairs and Leader of the Delegation of Sri Lanka – 30 September 2019

On September 30, 2019, Mr. Ravinatha P Aryasinha, Secretary of Foreign Affairs and Leader of the Sri Lankan Delegation, addressed the 74th UN General Assembly. He delivered a speech in the presence of the President, Secretary-General, and Excellencies.
Foreign Secretary Aryasinha discusses obstacles placed on Sri Lanka’s Peacekeeping Contribution to the UN

Foreign Secretary Ravinatha Aryasinha and Sri Lanka's delegation, including the Permanent Representative to the UN, met with the Under Secretary General of the United Nations in New York to discuss obstacles hindering Sri Lanka's Peacekeeping Contribution to the UN.
Foreign Secretary Aryasinha welcomes proposal for Maldives’ readmission to Commonwealth

Foreign Secretary Ravinatha Aryasinha led the Sri Lanka Delegation at the Commonwealth Foreign Affairs Ministers Meeting in New York on September 26, 2019, during the 74th Session of the United Nations. He welcomed the proposal for the Maldives' readmission to the Commonwealth.
Foreign Secretary Aryasinha underscores the relevance of the Bandung Principles as global multilateral mechanisms come under strain

Foreign Secretary Ravinatha Aryasinha emphasized the relevance of the Bandung Principles during his address at the Ministerial Meeting of the Non-Aligned Movement (NAM) on September 26, 2019, at the UN Headquarters in New York. He highlighted this significance as global multilateral mechanisms face increasing strain, coinciding with the 74th Session of the United Nations.
Comment of the Deputy Spokesman for the UN Secretary General
The Deputy Spokesman for the UN Secretary-General announced on September 25, 2019, that the UN Department of Peace Operations will repatriate a Sri Lankan Army unit and individual officials.
Sri Lanka condemns drone attacks in Saudi Arabia

Sri Lanka has condemned the drone attacks on the Abqaiq oil processing facility and Khurais oil field in Saudi Arabia. The country, having experienced terrorism for thirty years, remains steadfast in its commitment to denounce such acts of violence.
Foreign Ministry Led 8th Integrated Consular Mobile Service Concludes  in the Nuwara Eliya District

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs, led by Foreign Minister Tilak Marapana, successfully concluded the 8th Integrated Consular Mobile Service in the Nuwara Eliya District. This service aimed to provide consular assistance and services to the local community, enhancing accessibility and efficiency in consular affairs.
Sri Lanka and Australia conclude First Maritime Dialogue and Third Round of Senior Officials’ Talks in Colombo

Sri Lanka and Australia concluded their First Maritime Dialogue and Third Round of Senior Officials’ Talks in Colombo. The talks, held at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs on September 17, 2019, were led by the Sri Lankan delegation headed by Additional Secretary for Bilateral Affairs.
Statement by Deputy Permanent Representative of Sri Lanka to the United Nations in Geneva, Dayani Mendis, at the 42nd Session of the Human Rights Council – 11 September 2019

Dayani Mendis, Deputy Permanent Representative of Sri Lanka to the United Nations in Geneva, addressed the 42nd Session of the Human Rights Council on September 11, 2019. Mendis referred to the follow-up report of the Working Group on enforced disappearances regarding the implementation of recommendations made after their 2015 visit to Sri Lanka.
Statement by Permanent Representative of Sri Lanka to the United Nations in Geneva, Ambassador A.L.A. Azeez, at the 42nd Session of the Human Rights Council – 11 September 2019

At the 42nd Session of the Human Rights Council on September 11, 2019, Sri Lanka's Permanent Representative to the United Nations in Geneva, Ambassador A.L.A. Azeez, highlighted the resilience of Sri Lanka's security forces following the terrorist attacks on Easter Sunday over 4 months ago.
Sri Lanka and Australia to strengthen cooperation to counter people smuggling

Sri Lanka and Australia have reaffirmed their commitment to combat people smuggling by exploring ways to enhance cooperation in response to the recent increase in smuggling activities. The two countries are working together to address the escalating challenges posed by illegal ventures.
Sri Lanka seeks assistance in preventing violent extremism

Sri Lanka has requested assistance from the Global Community Engagement & Resilience Fund (GCERF) to prevent violent extremism following the Easter Sunday attacks. The country aims to enhance its expertise in countering violent extremism in the current scenario.
Valedictory address by Mr. Ravinatha Aryasinha, Secretary, Ministry of  Foreign Affairs at  Colombo Defence Seminar on 30 August 2019

Mr. Ravinatha Aryasinha, Secretary of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, delivered the valedictory address at the Colombo Defence Seminar on August 30, 2019. He commended the Sri Lanka Army for organizing the seminar for the 9th consecutive year, emphasizing its growing international significance.
Foreign Secretary Aryasinha says Post 21/4 a ‘litmus test’  for Sri Lanka in protecting human rights while fighting terrorism

Foreign Secretary Ravinatha Aryasinha stated that the period after 21/4 serves as a crucial test for Sri Lanka in balancing human rights protection with counterterrorism efforts. This phase will reveal both the country's commitment to human rights standards and areas needing improvement.
Joint Press Release Following the Meeting of the European Union-Sri Lanka 4th Working Group on Good Governance, Rule of Law and Human Rights

The European Union-Sri Lanka 4th Working Group on Good Governance, Rule of Law, and Human Rights met in Colombo on August 30, 2019. The meeting was part of the Joint Commission discussions, focusing on enhancing governance and human rights practices. This meeting signifies ongoing efforts to strengthen cooperation between the EU and Sri Lanka in these critical areas.
Sri Lanka and Venezuela agree to forge closer bilateral ties

Sri Lanka and Venezuela have agreed to strengthen their bilateral ties, with State Minister of Foreign Affairs Vasantha Senanayake meeting Venezuelan Vice Minister of Foreign Affairs Ruben Dario Molina during his official visit to Sri Lanka. The meeting took place at the Foreign Ministry, signaling a commitment to enhancing cooperation between the two countries.
Integrated Consular Mobile Service [ICMS] Conducted in Kurunegala and Dambulla

The Ministry organized an Integrated Consular Mobile Service in Kurunegala and Dambulla under the guidance of Foreign Minister Tilak Marapana, benefiting the general public from distant regions. This initiative aimed to provide consular outreach services to residents in these areas.
Appointment of Lt. Gen. Shavendra Silva, Commander of the Sri Lanka Army
Lt. Gen. Shavendra Silva has been appointed as the Commander of the Sri Lanka Army, a decision made by the Head of State. The appointment has sparked various comments and discussions.
Appointment of the Ambassador of the Kingdom of the Netherlands to Sri Lanka

The Government of the Kingdom of the Netherlands, with the approval of the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mrs. Tanja Gonggrijp as the new Ambassador of the Netherlands to Sri Lanka. She succeeds [mention name of the predecessor].
Appointment of the High Commissioner of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland to Sri Lanka

The Government of the United Kingdom, in agreement with Sri Lanka, has appointed Mrs. Sarah Anne Pascale Hulton as the High Commissioner of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland to Sri Lanka.
Appointment of the Ambassador of the Kingdom of Norway to Sri Lanka
The Government of the Kingdom of Norway, with the approval of the Government of Sri Lanka, has named Ms. Trine Jøranli Eskedal as the new Ambassador of Norway to Sri Lanka, succeeding H.E. Thorbjør.
Sri Lanka led IORA Maritime Safety and Security Working Group finalizes Work Plan

Sri Lanka, leading the IORA Maritime Safety and Security Working Group, finalized its Work Plan during the First Meeting held in Colombo on 8-9 August. The meeting included 22 foreign delegates representing IORA member countries, focusing on enhancing maritime safety and security in the region.
UN Special Rapporteur on Freedom of Religion or Belief visits Sri Lanka

The UN Special Rapporteur on Freedom of Religion or Belief, Ahmed Shaheed, began his official visit to Sri Lanka from August 15 to 26. He met with Minister Tilak Marapana at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs to discuss religious freedom issues in the country.
Thirteen new Heads of Mission approved by High Posts Committee –	Career HOM ratio rises from 37% to 54% within this year

Thirteen new Heads of Mission have been approved by the High Posts Committee, increasing the Career HOM ratio from 37% to 54% this year. The Committee on High Posts of the Parliament of Sri Lanka has examined and approved the appointments.
Sri Lanka's President Maithripala Sirisena visited Cambodia at the invitation of King Norodom Sihamoni. The two countries issued a joint statement during the state visit.
Foreign Secretary Aryasinha calls for early inclusion of Sri Lanka as an ASEAN Sectoral Dialogue Partner

Foreign Secretary Ravinatha Aryasinha urged ASEAN on Thursday to promptly include Sri Lanka as an ASEAN Sectoral Dialogue Partner to enhance engagement with the organization. This move aims to strengthen ties between Sri Lanka and ASEAN.

Condolence Message from Hon. Tilak Marapana Minister of Foreign Affairs of Sri Lanka to Hon. (Dr.) Subrahmanyam Jaishankar,Minister of External Affairs of the Republic of India on the demise of the former External Affairs Minister Smt. Sushma Swaraj
Foreign Ministry to conduct Integrated Consular Mobile Services in Anuradhapura and Puttalam Districts

The Foreign Ministry will conduct Integrated Consular Mobile Services in Anuradhapura and Puttalam Districts on August 17 and 19, 2019, respectively. This mobile consular service aims to provide assistance to residents in those areas.
Sri Lanka hosts the first meeting of the IORA Maritime Safety and Security Working Group on 8th and 9th August 2019

Sri Lanka is hosting the first meeting of the Indian Ocean Rim Association (IORA) Maritime Safety and Security Working Group (MSSWG) in Colombo on 8th and 9th August 2019. The meeting aims to finalize the Work Plan for enhancing maritime safety and security in the region.
Foreign Minister Marapana calls for increased cooperation to combat regional security challenges at the 26th ASEAN Regional Forum

Foreign Minister Tilak Marapana emphasized the need for increased cooperation to address regional security challenges at the 26th ASEAN Regional Forum in Bangkok, Thailand on August 2, 2019. He called for concerted global efforts to counter traditional security threats and enhance regional stability.

Special Statement by Hon. Tilak Marapana, Minister of Foreign Affairs in Parliament regarding the concerns raised over the visit of the Special Rapporteur on the freedom of assembly and of association

In a special statement in Parliament, Hon. Tilak Marapana, Minister of Foreign Affairs, addressed concerns raised by Members regarding the visit of the Special Rapporteur on the freedom of assembly and of association on July 23 and 24.
Germany charges suspect over 2005 killing of Sri Lanka Foreign Minister – Press Statement by the Federal General Prosecutor of Germany, 24.07.2019

Germany's Federal Attorney General has charged a suspect with aiding and abetting the 2005 murder of Sri Lanka's Foreign Minister, linking the individual to the terrorist group LTTE. The charges were announced in a press statement by the Federal General Prosecutor of Germany on July 24, 2019.
Foreign Ministry Conducts Consular Awareness Programmes and Mobile Services

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs conducted Consular Awareness Programmes and Integrated Consular Mobile Services (ICMS) in Trincomalee and Ka, led by Foreign Minister Tilak Marapana. The programs aimed to provide consular services and information to the public.
UN Special Rapporteur on the rights of freedom of association and peaceful assembly on country visit

UN Special Rapporteur on the rights of freedom of association and peaceful assembly, Mr. Clément Nyaletsossi Voule, has started his official country visit to Sri Lanka from July 18 to 26, 2019. During his visit, he met with the Foreign Minister.
First Ad-Hoc Dialogue on Counter Terrorism Cooperation with EU in Colombo

A delegation led by EU Counter Terrorism Coordinator Gilles de Kerchove visited Sri Lanka from 11 to 16 July 2019 for the first EU-Sri Lanka Ad Hoc Dialogue on Counter Terrorism Cooperation. The dialogue aimed to enhance cooperation in combating terrorism and was co-chaired by representatives from both sides.
Sri Lanka appreciates support and solidarity extended by the Commonwealth membership in the aftermath of the Easter Sunday tragedy

Sri Lanka expressed gratitude for the support and solidarity from Commonwealth members following the Easter Sunday tragedy. Secretary of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Ravinatha Aryasinha, conveyed this appreciation during the Commonwealth Foreign Affairs Ministers Meeting on Wednesday, July 10.
Establishment of Diplomatic Relations between Sri Lanka and Barbados

Sri Lanka and Barbados have established diplomatic relations through the signing of an agreement by their respective ambassadors, H.E. Dr. Amrith Rohan Perera and H.E. Ms. H. Elizabeth Thompson at the United Nations. This agreement signifies a new chapter in the bilateral relations between the two countries.
Commemoration of 60 Years of Diplomatic Ties between Sri Lanka and Cuba

State Minister of Foreign Affairs Vasantha Senanayake visited the Republic of Cuba from June 25 to 29 to mark the 60th anniversary of diplomatic relations between Sri Lanka and Cuba. The visit aimed to commemorate the establishment of these ties and strengthen bilateral cooperation between the two countries.
Establishment of Diplomatic Relations between Sri Lanka and Saint Lucia

Sri Lanka and Saint Lucia have established diplomatic relations with the signing of an agreement by their respective ambassadors, H.E. Dr. Amrith Rohan Perera and H.E. Mr. Cosmos Richardson at the United Nations. This agreement signifies a formal recognition of diplomatic ties between the two countries.
Sri Lanka Updates HRC on Human Rights Measures taken to advance Human Rights, Peace and Security

Sri Lanka's delegation updated the Human Rights Council on the progress made in addressing human rights concerns, national security imperatives, and reconciliation priorities. The briefing focused on measures taken to advance human rights, peace, and security in the country.
Committee of Senior Officials of IORA successfully concluded in Durban, South Africa

The ninth Bi-Annual Committee of Senior Officials (CSO) of the Indian Ocean Rim Association (IORA) successfully concluded in Durban, South Africa on June 20, 2019. The session was chaired by Ambassador Anil Sooklal, providing a platform for discussions and collaborations among IORA member states.
President Duterte confers Order of Sikatuna on Ambassador Aruni Ranaraja
President Rodrigo Roa Duterte conferred the Order of Sikatuna with the rank of Grand Cross (Datu), gold distinction on Ambassador Aruni Ranaraja of Sri Lanka on June 18, 2021.

Foreign Minister Marapana and Hungarian counterpart Péter Szijjártó discuss roadmap for viable, results oriented and mutually beneficial Sri Lanka –Hungary bilateral partnership as two countries celebrate sixty years of diplomatic relations this year

Foreign Minister Tilak Marapana visited Budapest to hold bilateral discussions with Hungarian Foreign Affairs and Trade Minister Péter Szijjártó. The meeting focused on establishing a roadmap for a viable and mutually beneficial partnership between Sri Lanka and Hungary as the two countries mark sixty years of diplomatic relations this year.
Consular Mobile Service conducted                                                                   in Mullaitivu, under ‘Rata Wenuwen Ekata Sitimu’ Programme

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs conducted a Consular Mobile Service in Mullaitivu as part of the 'Rata Wenuwen Ekata Sitimu' Programme, under the guidance of President Maithripala Sirisena. This initiative aims to provide swift and efficient services to the public.

During a meeting between the Presidents of Sri Lanka and Tajikistan, they focused on enhancing bilateral relations through established mechanisms. President Maithripala Sirisena expressed his commitment to collaborating closely with other nations worldwide.
Foreign Ministry Participates at the Rajya Sewaya Gamata Gena Yana Janatha Sewaya Programme

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs took part in the inaugural 'Rajya Sewaya Gamata Gena Yana Janatha Sewaya' national program in Matale on June 1, 2019. They conducted a consular mobile service at the event premises. This initiative aimed to provide consular services to the public in a convenient manner.
Sri Lanka to give effect to UN Security Council resolutions to counter terrorism and violent extremism

Sri Lanka is set to implement UN Security Council resolutions to combat terrorism and violent extremism, with a focus on collaborating with UN mechanisms in line with international norms. This initiative was highlighted during the recent visit to Sri Lanka by the UN Assistant Secretary General.
Foreign Minister Marapana shares Sri Lanka experience in addressing sexual and gender based violence in humanitarian crises in Oslo

Foreign Minister Tilak Marapana shared Sri Lanka's experience in addressing sexual and gender-based violence in humanitarian crises at an international conference in Oslo on May 24, 2019. He participated as a panelist at the event focused on 'Ending Sexual and Gender-based Violence in Humanitarian Crises'.
HE Maithripala Sirisena, President of Sri Lanka attends the Swearing-in-Ceremony of Prime Minister Narendra Modi
